app.title: Jordan Biesmans — Web developer
app.description: Portfolio of Jordan Biesmans, frontend-focused web developer (Next.js, React, TypeScript) — designing modern, performant and maintainable interfaces.

hero.tagline: I craft modern digital experiences, presented in a modern interface.

layout.name: Jordan Biesmans
layout.role: Web developer — Next.js, React, Node.js, TypeScript

home.body: Web developer specialized in Next.js / React / TypeScript. I build modern digital experiences optimized for today’s needs: performance, SEO, accessibility and code quality.

console.title: DEV CONSOLE // AVAILABILITY
console.line3: > location: remote France / Europe, hybrid (Paris, Rennes, Laval)
console.availability: Open slots to start a new project in the coming weeks.

projects.title: Concrete work for real-world needs
projects.description: A selection of platforms and applications I’ve worked on recently, with a strong focus on performance, accessibility and frontend architecture quality.

items.name: Adequancy
items.impact: End-to-end development of the platform, with advanced SEO and performance optimisations on complex pages.
items.meta: Project for a player in the interim management market.

items.name: Promea
items.stack: Next.js, React Query, Zustand, Fastify, TRPC, Prisma, Zod
items.impact: Built a solid frontend foundation in DDD (Domain Driven Design) and some backend interventions, focused on accessibility and long-term maintainability.
items.meta: Tool to support and follow employees with disabilities.

items.name: Mediawan
items.impact: Precise UI integration, polished animations and multilingual support.
items.meta: Project for a European media group.

items.name: Reboat
items.stack: Next.js, Directus, SSR, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
items.impact: Implementation of several reusable components on Directus to allow the client to create its own pages with the content and order of the components of its choice.
items.meta: Project for a boat rental service.

items.name: Sacré Brunch
items.impact: Redesigned the booking flow, integrated a tool for managing rooms/reservations and implemented an online shop connected to Stripe.
items.meta: Project for an event-driven brunch concept.

items.name: Le P'tit Champ
items.impact: Implementation of a back-office for order and customer management.
items.meta: Project for a farmer's market in a closed circuit.

items.name: Vertical Sync (Personal project)
items.stack: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Shadcn/UI, Tailwind CSS, Leaflet, AWS S3, Neon DB, Clerk.js, Vercel
items.impact: Implementation of an application with a blog, a forum, an interactive map of climbing spots in France, with information on weather conditions, difficulties, comments, photos, videos, etc.
items.meta: Project for an application around climbing.

items.name: ioTactile Games (Personal project)
items.impact: Implementation of a multiplayer and solo board game application, with an integrated music player
items.meta: Project for a board game application.

about.title: A frontend developer who thinks in products
about.intro: I’m Jordan Biesmans, a web developer focused on the React / Next.js / TypeScript ecosystem. I design modern interfaces that are built to be fast, accessible and maintainable.
highlights: Over 3 years of freelance experience on projects for startups, SMBs and large companies.
Used to collaborating with product, design and backend teams in agile environments.
Strong focus on frontend architecture quality, SEO, performance and accessibility.
about.stack_title: What I work with day to day
stack_items: React Query, React hooks forms, Zustand, Zod
Shadcn/UI, Tailwind CSS, design systems, Figma handoff
Fastify, TRPC, Prisma, APIs REST, Cache management, SSR / Server Components (Next.js)
Stripe, Resend, AWS, Vercel, Docker, Linux
about.cta: Available for frontend and light full‑stack missions, remote or hybrid.

contact.title: Let’s talk about your project
contact.intro: Whether you need help on an existing interface, a fast MVP or a full redesign, feel free to reach out through this form.

form.name_placeholder: Your name or your organisation’s name
form.message_placeholder: Tell me about your project, your context or what you’d like to improve…

feedback.success: Thanks, your message has been sent.
feedback.error: Something went wrong while sending your message. You can also email me directly.
